title: "import deeplabcut" produces " 'TkAgg' which requires the 'tk' " error when remote accessing from Mac OS
body:
Tyler VanBuren “import deeplabcut” disabled due to remote access from Mac OS Remote Access Computer: VERSION="16.04.6 LTS (Xenial Xerus)" PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS" Your Operating system: System Version: macOS 10.15.4 (19E287) Kernel Version: Darwin 19.4.0 Please complete the following information about your system: OS: [Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS] DeepLabCut Version: [2.X] (issue with “import deeplabcut”) Anaconda env used: Python 3 Describe the problem: When typing into jupyter notebook, that is running on linux from a remote Mac, it gives the error code: Cannot load backend 'TkAgg' which requires the 'tk' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running A clear and concise description of what the problem is: import deeplabcut on linux is producing an error when using remote access from Mac. Error posted below. Please place code inside this:
Code output

```python Full Error Report: ImportError Traceback (most recent call last) in () ----> 1 import deeplabcut /home/vanbur28/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py in () 28 else: 29 mpl.use('Agg') ---> 30 from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset 31 from deeplabcut import refine_training_dataset 32 from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset import label_frames, dropannotationfileentriesduetodeletedimages, comparevideolistsanddatafolders, dropimagesduetolackofannotation /home/vanbur28/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/__init__.py in () 17 else: 18 from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.auxfun_drag_label import * ---> 19 from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.labeling_toolbox import * 20 from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox import * 21 from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.frame_extraction_toolbox import * /home/vanbur28/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/labeling_toolbox.py in () 25 import argparse 26 from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset import auxfun_drag_label ---> 27 from deeplabcut.utils import auxiliaryfunctions 28 from matplotlib.backends.backend_wxagg import FigureCanvasWxAgg as FigureCanvas 29 from matplotlib.backends.backend_wxagg import NavigationToolbar2WxAgg as NavigationToolbar /home/vanbur28/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/__init__.py in () ----> 1 from deeplabcut.utils.make_labeled_video import * 2 from deeplabcut.utils.auxiliaryfunctions import * 3 from deeplabcut.utils.video_processor import * 4 from deeplabcut.utils.plotting import * 5 /home/vanbur28/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py in () 32 mpl.use('WxAgg') #TkAgg 33 else: ---> 34 mpl.use('TkAgg') 35 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 36 /opt/anaconda3/envs/dlc-ubuntu-GPU/lib/python3.6/site-packages/matplotlib/__init__.py in use(arg, warn, force) 1389 if force: 1390 from matplotlib.pyplot import switch_backend -> 1391 switch_backend(name) 1392 # Finally if pyplot is not imported update both rcParams and 1393 # rcDefaults so restoring the defaults later with rcdefaults /opt/anaconda3/envs/dlc-ubuntu-GPU/lib/python3.6/site-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py in switch_backend(newbackend) 220 "Cannot load backend {!r} which requires the {!r} interactive " 221 "framework, as {!r} is currently running".format( --> 222 newbackend, required_framework, current_framework)) 223 224 rcParams['backend'] = rcParamsDefault['backend'] = newbackend ImportError: Cannot load backend 'TkAgg' which requires the 'tk' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running ```

How to Reproduce the problem Steps to reproduce the behavior: Remote access to computer: Using Mac computer to log into campus network using pulse secure -> Enter into Mac terminal to access linux computer: ssh -L localhost:8888:localhost:8888 @xx.xx.xxx.xxx --> Type into linux computer terminal: conda activate dlc-ubuntu-GPU --> Type into linux computer terminal: jupyter notebook --no-browser --port=8888 --> Type into Mac browser (used chrome and safari): The link given for jupyter session --> In jupyter notebook opened from Mac entered: import deeplabcut
